alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; Lawrence; Newton; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Lawrence, Newton and Stone. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM CDT, Doppler radar estimated between 3 to 5 inches of rain fell over this area in the previous 24 hours. Minor flooding is expected to continue in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Center Creek at County Road 2220, Flat Creek at Highway C and Dry Crane Creek at Jasmine Road. This advisory will replace the flash flood warning which expires at 515 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Marionville, Crane, Pierce City, Verona and Galena. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
